text:
Running on W2K. Problem on both 1.5Beta1 and 1.6Apha(nightly).
1. Used the sample in the doc for antcall task.
<target name="default">
  <antcall target="doSomethingElse">
    <param name="param1" value="value"/>
  </antcall>
</target>
<target name="doSomethingElse">
  <echo message message="param1=${param1}"/>
</target>
2. Start ant to run this. Got the message:
param1=${param1}
instead of:
param1=value
3. Tried ant task instead:
<target name="default">
  <ant antfile="test.xml" target="doSomethingElse">
    <property name="param1" value="value"/>
  </antcall>
</target>
test.xml has the following:
<target name="doSomethingElse">
  <echo message message="param1=${param1}"/>
</target>

got the same result as #2.

Run these targets in 1.4.1 and got the right result!

If you run it -debug, do you ever see param1 getting set -- ie., see a line 
that says:
Setting ro project property: param1 -> value

What happens if you run the target with a define for param1 on the command line?

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
>> Complete build sequence is [doSomethingElse, default]

means doSomethingElse will be run before default (and hence param1 is unset).

How do you invoke your "default" target to test this?

> ant default

or

> ant

and have project's default attribute point to the target named default?

I don't think this is a Xerces problem (Ant intends to support any JAXP
compliant parser), maybe it is a problem with the WSAG integration you are
using.

The project default task is "default". I've run it both with
ant default
and just
ant.

WSAD-xerces integration I think is the problem!
